French farmer Richard Fontaine walks through a flooded cabbage field in Saint-Méloir-des-Ondes, western France on 19 February 2026. "It's terrible what's happening to us." In the bay of Mont-Saint-Michel, Yannick Frain, a market gardener and breeder, suffered the full force of the rains that hit the west of France for days, causing exceptional flooding and major damage. He passes, resignedly, in his field of carrots that looks like a rice field. Photo: AFP
